climbs.name: When in Doubt, Run it Out

content.description:
To the right of Looking for A Clue (the brown Pinnacles climbing book says Looking for A Clue was done by people looking for this route). Bottom is the hardest part, but can traverse in from the left to cut out hardest, unprotected, climbing.

Classic runout Pinnacles climbing.
content.protection: One Bolt, can potentially supplement with some tricam placements before the bolt and maybe something higher up in the seem before the bulge.

content.description: Start on Sound Chaser. Traverse left between the first and second bolt. Go straight up. No idea why the FA team didn't do this, and instead went way right and then back.

When setting anchor, you'll want to bring long some slings with you to avoid sharp rock cut off and friction. Access either by squeezing between the two leftmost rocks, or by walking up left. The crux is the first few moves to start off. Some fun balance switchbacks.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.  No rap rings, walk off.
content.location: This climb is at the eastern (left) end of the formations just right of Castles Made of Sand.

content.description: This is a fun climb. Huge holds, well protected. On second formation from left, just right of Relayer. Access bolt by squeezing between middle rock formations and climbing left. No rap rings, but you can walk off the back
content.protection: 3 bolts and a two bolt anchor.

content.description: On second from left rock formation(just right of Sound Chaser), this sucker is a pumpy route. Watch out for swing if you fall, the far left section is RIGHT there.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.  No rap rings, walk off.

content.description: The start is probably the crux on this one.  Climb up just on the left side of the arete passing 3 bolts along the way.  Little bit of a mantle move over the last bulge by the anchor.  Straightforward.
content.location: Far right side/arete of the main right face of the upper crust.

content.description: Follow the arete on the third formation from the left(second formation from the right). Nice warm up route. If you want to TR it, squeeze in between the middle rocks and climb left and around to the right side of the spire (er, pinnacle?). Don't try climbing up the rock itself, it's a bit sketchy to get up on the ledge.
content.protection: 4 protection bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with rap rings.

content.description: Start on the left side of the face near chimney and trend slightly right staying left of the bolt for "When in Doubt Run it Out" and then up.  Follow the sea of knobs up.
content.protection: Possible gear in the seam nearing the top, otherwise pretty much unprotected.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Left most climb on the large face to the right of Me and My Monkey.  Start on the left side of the face near chimney and trend slightly right and then straight up.

content.description: Six closely spaced bolts. Thin face climbing. The crux is the 20' bulge. Good rock. Sharp holds. Cold shuts on top.
content.location: First route you come to at the Upper Crust.

content.description: The crux comes in the form of a big unprotected move to get from the slab pseudo-finish to the top of the boulder which is the actual finish
content.protection:
2 bolts, but with a long sling you can use the 3rd bolt from Nodal Line which makes the crux here much less scary.

2 bolt fixed anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Immediately to the left of Nodal Line (when facing the wall)

content.description: Start on Sound Chaser. Traverse left at the second bolt across the face. Then join Castles Made of Sand at the bottom of the bulge. Fun/sustained.
content.location: TR from the bolts at the top of Castles Made of Sand

content.description: Relatively mild start leads up to the short and definite overhung crux passing the second bolt.  After gaining the large knob above second bolt, head toward the top on easy ground.
content.protection: 3 bolts and 2 bolt anchor, 3rd bolt has a rap ring on it to facilitate less rope drag while lowering.  A large knob could be slung for extra protection between 2nd and 3rd bolts.
content.location: Far left side of the upper crust area, just to the left of sound chaser and shares a 2 bolt anchor with that route.
